parts.name: Hive Scales
parts.description: The table contains data from hive scales from various apiaries in Austria. The geographical coordinates of the hive scales have been blurred. The interval of measurements range from 15 to 60 min.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Identifier of the record.

descriptor.name: recordID
descriptor.description: Unique sequence of integers associated with a record within a certain table.

columns.name: scale_name
columns.description: Name of the hive scale.

descriptor.name: Text
descriptor.description: > In computer programming, a string is traditionally a sequence of characters, either as a literal constant or as some kind of variable. The latter may allow its elements to be mutated and the length changed, or it may be fixed (after creation). A string is generally considered as a data type and is often implemented as an array data structure of bytes (or words) that stores a sequence of elements, typically characters, using some character encoding. String may also denote more general arrays or other sequence (or list) data types and structures.

columns.name: date
columns.description: Date and time of measurement.

descriptor.name: calendarDateAndTime
descriptor.description: > [date and time representation](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/741) [...] that includes all the [time scale components](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/736) [...] associated with the [expression](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/676) [...]

columns.name: temperature
columns.description: Temperature measured by the hive scale or and external device connected to the hive scale.

descriptor.name: temperature
descriptor.description: The physical [quantity](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/421) [Celsius temperature](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/433) expressed in [the derived SI unit with special name and symbol](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/8126) [degree Celcius](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/566).

columns.name: rh
columns.description: Relative humidity measured by the hive scale or and external device connected to the hive scale.

descriptor.name: relativeHumidity
descriptor.description: Relative humidity (RH) (expressed as a percent) also measures water vapor, but RELATIVE to the temperature of the air. In other words, it is a measure of the actual amount of water vapor in the air compared to the total amount of vapor that can exist in the air at its current temperature.

columns.name: prec
columns.description: Precipitation (liquid) measured by the hive scale or and external device connected to the hive scale.

descriptor.name: rainfall
descriptor.description: > The [amount of precipitatio](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Amount_of_precipitation)n of any type (including the liquid equivalent of frozen [hydrometeors](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Hydrometeors)); usually taken as that amount measured by means of a [rain gauge](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Rain_gauge) (thus a small, varying amount of direct [condensation](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Condensation) is included). A more accurate term would be precipitation or [precipitation](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Precipitation) amount. However, the broad use of "rainfall" is firmly established in meteorology, especially in hydrologic and climatological literature. Its best utilization would confine it to liquid precipitation, and so would provide a distinction between precipitation immediately accessible to soil and streams and that delayed in storage as [snow](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Snow) or [ice](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Ice) on the earth's surface.

columns.name: windspeed
columns.description: Wind speed measured by the hive scale or and external device connected to the hive scale.

descriptor.name: windSpeed
descriptor.description: > The rate at which air is moving horizontally past a given point. It may be a 2-minute average speed (reported as wind speed) or an instantaneous speed (reported as a peak wind speed, [wind gust](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7360), or squall).

columns.name: wgs84_n
columns.description: Geographical position (latitude) measured by the hive scale or and external device connected to the hive scale.

descriptor.name: decimalLatitude
descriptor.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_decimalLatitude):
> The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in [dwc:geodeticDatum](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7491)) of the geographic center of a [dcterms:Location](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7367). Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

columns.name: wgs84_e
columns.description: Geographical position (longitude) measured by the hive scale or and external device connected to the hive scale.

descriptor.name: decimalLongitude
descriptor.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_decimalLongitude):
> The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in [dwc:geodeticDatum](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7491)) of the geographic center of a [dcterms:Location](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7367). Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

columns.name: lau
columns.description: Local administrative units (LAU) in which the apiary is located where the hive scale is  stationed.

descriptor.name: lauCode
descriptor.description:
> To meet the demand for statistics at a local level, Eurostat maintains a system of local administrative units (LAUs) compatible with NUTS. These LAUs are the building blocks of the NUTS, and comprise the municipalities and communes of the European Union. [...]
> 
> The LAUs are:
> 
> administrative for reasons such as the availability of data and policy implementation capacity
> a subdivision of the NUTS 3 regions covering the whole economic territory of the Member States
> appropriate for the implementation of local level typologies included in Tercet, namely the coastal area and DEGURBA classification.
> Since there are frequent changes to the LAUs, Eurostat publishes an updated list towards the end of each year.
> 
> The NUTS regulation makes provision for EU Member States to send the lists of their LAUs to Eurostat. If available, Eurostat receives additionally basic administrative data by means of the annual LAU lists, namely total population and total area for each LAU.

columns.name: elevation
columns.description: Elevation above sea level of the apiary.

descriptor.name: verbatimElevation
descriptor.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_verbatimElevation):
> The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

columns.name: apiary
columns.description: Name of the apiary.

descriptor.name: apiaryName
descriptor.description: Unique name associated with an [apiary](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/5), which is specific to a [dataset](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7524) or to a [beekeeper](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/2987).

columns.name: weight
columns.description: Hive weight (mass) measured by the hicve scale.

descriptor.name: hiveWeight
descriptor.description: A measurement made by a weight sensor under a hive.

columns.name: winddir
columns.description: Wind direction in degrees relative to the north measured by the hive scale or and external device connected to the hive scale.

descriptor.name: windDirection
descriptor.description: The true direction from which the wind is blowing at a given location (i.e., wind blowing from the north to the south is a north wind). It is normally measured in tens of degrees from 10 degrees clockwise through 360 degrees. North is 360 degrees. A wind direction of 0 degrees is only used when wind is calm.

descriptors.name: hiveWeight
descriptors.description: A measurement made by a weight sensor under a hive.

> To meet the demand for statistics at a local level, Eurostat maintains a system of local administrative units (LAUs) compatible with NUTS. These LAUs are the building blocks of the NUTS, and comprise the municipalities and communes of the European Union. [...]
>

>

descriptors.notes: Recommended best practice is to provide the [complete representation](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/755) of date and time in the [extended format](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/868), as proposed by ISO 8601 ([YYYY]["-"][MM]["-"][DD] [hh][":"][mm][":"][ss]), where [YYYY] is a format representation of a [calendar year](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/3321), [MM] is a format representation of a [calendar month](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/3342), [DD] is a format representation of a [calendar day](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/3349), [hh] is a format representation of a [clock hour](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7402), [mm] is a format representation of a [clock minute](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7404), and [ss] is a format representation of a [clock second](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7405).

A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_decimalLongitude):
> The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in [dwc:geodeticDatum](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7491)) of the geographic center of a [dcterms:Location](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7367). Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

descriptors.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_decimalLatitude):
> The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in [dwc:geodeticDatum](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7491)) of the geographic center of a [dcterms:Location](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7367). Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

descriptors.name: recordID
descriptors.description: Unique sequence of integers associated with a record within a certain table.

descriptors.name: temperature
descriptors.description: The physical [quantity](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/421) [Celsius temperature](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/433) expressed in [the derived SI unit with special name and symbol](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/8126) [degree Celcius](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/566).

descriptors.name: relativeHumidity
descriptors.description: Relative humidity (RH) (expressed as a percent) also measures water vapor, but RELATIVE to the temperature of the air. In other words, it is a measure of the actual amount of water vapor in the air compared to the total amount of vapor that can exist in the air at its current temperature.

descriptors.name: verbatimElevation
descriptors.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_verbatimElevation):
> The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

descriptors.name: apiaryName
descriptors.description: Unique name associated with an [apiary](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/5), which is specific to a [dataset](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7524) or to a [beekeeper](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/2987).

descriptors.name: rainfall
descriptors.description: > The [amount of precipitatio](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Amount_of_precipitation)n of any type (including the liquid equivalent of frozen [hydrometeors](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Hydrometeors)); usually taken as that amount measured by means of a [rain gauge](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Rain_gauge) (thus a small, varying amount of direct [condensation](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Condensation) is included). A more accurate term would be precipitation or [precipitation](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Precipitation) amount. However, the broad use of "rainfall" is firmly established in meteorology, especially in hydrologic and climatological literature. Its best utilization would confine it to liquid precipitation, and so would provide a distinction between precipitation immediately accessible to soil and streams and that delayed in storage as [snow](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Snow) or [ice](https://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Ice) on the earth's surface.

descriptors.name: windSpeed
descriptors.description: > The rate at which air is moving horizontally past a given point. It may be a 2-minute average speed (reported as wind speed) or an instantaneous speed (reported as a peak wind speed, [wind gust](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7360), or squall).

descriptors.name: windDirection
descriptors.description: The true direction from which the wind is blowing at a given location (i.e., wind blowing from the north to the south is a north wind). It is normally measured in tens of degrees from 10 degrees clockwise through 360 degrees. North is 360 degrees. A wind direction of 0 degrees is only used when wind is calm.

data.description: This dataset contains data on regular assessemnts of colony development in colonies exposed to different levels of Clothinanidin as a consequence of corn production.

parts.name: Calibration
parts.description: The table contains the results from the calibration of operators for the estimation of the number of bees on frames. The persons who estimated colony size had to carry out a calibration immediately before the start of the estimation if the last calibration was more than a week ago. For the calibration, 20 photos of frames with a known number (578-1278) of bees were presented to the persons carrying out the estimation in order to determine measurement accuracy.

parts.name: Colony
parts.description: The table contains the results from the assessments of colony size. The number of adult bees in a colony was determined by estimation. The estimation was carried out before the start of flight (<12°C) in all frames of a colony by 2 persons, whereby one person estimated the number of adult bees and a second person recorded the data in writing. The estimation was always started in the bottom hive box. The colony was opened accompanied by a few puffs of smoke. The number of bees on the bottom board and on the frame walls was estimated to the nearest 50 bees. Then a frame was removed from the box and the number of bees sitting on each side of the frame was estimated to the nearest 50 bees. The geometric shape of the brood nest (elliptical or rectangular) was noted and its maximum horizontal and vertical extension was measured to the nearest 5 mm using a rule. This process was carried out in all frames of the hive.

descriptor.name: lauCode
descriptor.description:
> To meet the demand for statistics at a local level, Eurostat maintains a system of local administrative units (LAUs) compatible with NUTS. These LAUs are the building blocks of the NUTS, and comprise the municipalities and communes of the European Union. [...]
> 
> The LAUs are:
> 
> administrative for reasons such as the availability of data and policy implementation capacity
> a subdivision of the NUTS 3 regions covering the whole economic territory of the Member States
> appropriate for the implementation of local level typologies included in Tercet, namely the coastal area and DEGURBA classification.
> Since there are frequent changes to the LAUs, Eurostat publishes an updated list towards the end of each year.
> 
> The NUTS regulation makes provision for EU Member States to send the lists of their LAUs to Eurostat. If available, Eurostat receives additionally basic administrative data by means of the annual LAU lists, namely total population and total area for each LAU.

data.name: FAOSTAT LC Land Cover
data.long_name: FAOSTAT Land Cover
data.description: The FAOSTAT domain Land Cover under the Agri-Environmental Indicators section contains land cover information organized by the land cover classes of the international standard system for Environmental and Economic Accounting Central Framework (SEEA CF). The land cover information is compiled from publicly available Global Land Cover (GLC) maps: a) MODIS land cover types based on the Land Cover Classification System, LCCS (2001–2021); b) The European Spatial Agency (ESA) Climate Change Initiative (CCI) annual land cover maps (1992–2020) produced by the Université catholique de Louvain (UCL)-Geomatics and now under the European Copernicus Program; c) The annual land cover maps which were produced under the European Copernicus Global Land Service (CGLS) (CGLS land cover, containing discrete land cover categorization for the period 2015–2019), with spatial resolution 100m; and d) 4) The WorldCover maps of the European Space Agency —available for the years 2020 and 2021, produced at 10m resolution.

descriptors.name: Text
descriptors.description: > In computer programming, a string is traditionally a sequence of characters, either as a literal constant or as some kind of variable. The latter may allow its elements to be mutated and the length changed, or it may be fixed (after creation). A string is generally considered as a data type and is often implemented as an array data structure of bytes (or words) that stores a sequence of elements, typically characters, using some character encoding. String may also denote more general arrays or other sequence (or list) data types and structures.

data.name: FAOSTAT RL Land Use
data.long_name: FAOSTAT data on land, inputs and sustainability - land use
data.description: The FAOSTAT Land Use domain contains data on forty-four categories of land use, irrigation and agricultural practices and five indicators relevant to monitor agriculture, forestry and fisheries activities at national, regional and global level. Data are available by country and year, with global coverage and annual updates.

entities.name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

parts.name: Input Land Use
parts.description: The FAOSTAT Land Use domain contains data on twenty-one land use categories, twentythree categories of irrigation and agricultural practices and six indicators of land use. The data are collected via the FAO Questionnaire on Land Use, Irrigation and Agricultural Practices, based on the FAO Land Use classification. The information in the Land Use domain is relevant to monitor sustainable and productive agriculture, forestry and fisheries activities at national, regional and global level. Statistics on agricultural land area are an integral component of SDG indicator 2.4.1. Data are available by country and year, covering up to 246 countries and territories, with annual updates. The current dissemination covers the period 1961–2021. Last update was on 2024-02-15.

data.name: FAOSTAT QCL Beekeeping
data.long_name: FAOSTAT data on beekeeping livestock and products
data.description: This dataset contains beekeeping related data from the FAOSTAT crop and livestock statistics, which are recorded for 278 products, among which primary livestock products such as beeswax and honey and live animals such as the number for beehives for the whole world. It includes also the relevant metadata published by FAO.

data.name: FAOSTAT TCL Trade
data.long_name: FAOSTAT data on the trade with beekeeping livestock and products
data.description: The food and agricultural trade dataset is collected, processed and disseminated by FAO according to the standard International Merchandise Trade Statistics (IMTS) Methodology. The data is mainly provided by UNSD, Eurostat, and other national authorities as needed. This source data is checked for outliers, trade partner data is used for non-reporting countries or missing cells, and data on food aid is added to take into account total cross-border trade flows. The trade database includes the following variables: export quantity, export value, import quantity, and import value. The trade database includes all food and agricultural products imported/exported annually by all the countries in the world.
data.acquisition: All raw data files were downloaded from the website of [FAOSTAT](https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/TCL)
data.preparation: RAw data files were processed using a SQL database (MariaDB foundation, server version 10.4.32) running in an XAMPP environment (BitRock, version 5.2.1).

data.name: FAOSTAT TM Trade Matrix
data.long_name: FAOSTAT data on the detailed trade matrix with beekeeping livestock and products
data.description: The food and agricultural trade dataset is collected, processed and disseminated by FAO according to the standard International Merchandise Trade Statistics (IMTS) Methodology. The data is mainly provided by UNSD, Eurostat, and other national authorities as needed. This source data is checked for outliers, trade partner data is used for non-reporting countries or missing cells, and data on food aid is added to take into account total cross-border trade flows. The trade database includes the following variables: export quantity, export value, import quantity, and import value. The trade database includes all food and agricultural products imported/exported annually by all the countries in the world.
data.acquisition:
All raw data files were downloaded from the website of [FAOSTAT](https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/TM). 

**List of raw data obtained from the data provider.**
1. Archive *Trade_DetailedTradeMatrix_E_All_Data_(Normalized).zip* accessed on 2024-02-12 14:29:30, provided by [FAOSTAT](https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/TM)
data.preparation: Raw data files were processed using a SQL database (MariaDB foundation, server version 10.4.32) running in an XAMPP environment (BitRock, version 5.2.1).

data.name: DEPAB2
data.long_name: DEPAB2 : Pollen, pesticides and landscape
data.description:
DEPAB2 : Pollen, pesticides and landscape

Honey bees pollen samples from Belgium, their species composition identified with classical microscopy, their pesticides content and the landscape around the apiaries in which they have been collected. Data from a project called DEPAB2 in Belgium.

Dataset related to the following paper : 
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-017-03467-5  
Simon-Delso, N., San Martin, G., Bruneau, E., Delcourt, C., Hautier, L., 2017. The challenges of predicting pesticide exposure of honey bees at landscape level. Scientific Reports 7, 3801. doi:10.1038/s41598-017-03467-5

parts.name: lib_pesticides
parts.description:
This is a reference library of the pesticides measured in different matrices of the colonies.

It can be used to know the LOQs of the analyses and to know the full list of pesticides that were included in the multiresidue analyses (cfr table pollen_pesticides).

It has been used in a previous project called "DEPAB1" and then completed with the few additional chemicals that were analysed for the pollen data only (DEPAB2 project).
So in this dataset (containing only the pollen data), we have only measured the pesticides that have a non missing value in the LOQ_Pollen column

The Wax, Beebread and Honey have been analyzed in the same colonies (DEPAB1) while the pollen samples have been analysed for a slightly different set of colonies (DEPAB2).  
The analytical methods used for the pollen samples had a much lower LOQ because we wanted to be able to detect very small quantities of neonicotinoids.

parts.name: pollen_dates
parts.description:
In this dataset, each sample (sample_ID) can correspond to several sampling dates that have been pooled together in one unique sample for the lab analysis

This table can be used to calculate how many sampling dates are involved for each sample as this could have an influence on some characteristics of the data (like pollen diversity).

parts.name: pollen_pesticides
parts.description:
Pesticides analyses from the pollen samples.

Two values = 0 (Imidacloprid 35A APRI 2012 `Sample_ID` = 47 and thiamethoxam 21A AUG 2011, `Sample_ID` = 17) : these Pesticides where detected but were below LOD (positive below LOD (0,25 µg/kg)).
For a signal at the LOD, the alpha error (probability of false positive) is small (1%).
See : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detection_limit

`ID1` = ID from the lab that performed the analyses ?
`ID2` : CARI ID
`Sample_ID` = ID that must be used to merge these data with the palynological dataset

14 March 2016
correction of an encoding error in ID2 = 21B SEPT 2011 : the IDApiary was 21A, it has been transformed into 21B

parts.name: Aggregation
parts.description:
List of the cultures for which the 3 main pesticides found are athorized in Belgium. 
We used this information to infer which were the crops on which the use of  each product was authorized in 2011.  
Provided by Bernard Weickmans from an export from the Phytoweb database (15/09/2015)  
NB : when the whole product is withdrawn from the market, the information is kept in the database.
When only one specific use (on one culture) is no more authorized this use is simply removed from the database (so there are no more traces about this specific use in the database).

* `MLB_MOGELIJKE_ACTIEVE_STOFFEN_NAAM_FR` : Pesticide
* `HPNAAM` : commercial Name
* `DATUM_AFLEVERING` : date of first agreation
* `DATUM_OPMAAK` : Date of the current ageation
* `INGETROKKEN` : Has the product been withdrawn from the market ? Yes/No
* `DATUM_INTREKKING` : Date of the product withdrawn from the market
* `Composition`
* `MLB_MOGELIJKE_GEWASSEN_NAAM_FR` : type of cultures on which the product is authorized
* `MLB_GEWAS_BEGINSTADIUM_FR` : when the product can be applied
* `DOSIS_OF_CONCENTRATIE_FR` : authorized dose
* `MLB_MOGELIJKE_VIJANDEN_NAAM_FR` : target of the product
* `MLB_VIJAND_BEGINSTADIUM_FR` : start of the use (relative to the stadium of the target)
* `EINDSTADIUM_FR` : end of use

parts.name: DEPAB1_data
parts.description:
This dataset contains Colony health, pesticides and virus content data for the first part of the project. These data have not been used here in the analyses. We just used these results to compare the frequences of the pesticides in the different matrices.

These are the compiled data from raw sources used for the 2014 PLoS One paper.
The raw data and the compilation procedure is described here (Gilles' computer): 
`/home/gilles/stats/OtherRprojects/LouisHautier/bees2/create_raw_data`

Group: Disorder vs Healthy

State : description of the problems observed into the colonies: 

* M : mortality of the colony (Mortalité)
* R : problem with the queen (Reine)
* C : problem with the brood (Couvain)
* A : weakening of the colony (Affaiblissement)
* V : Healthy colony

Visit: 
* 1 : Summer 2011
* 2 : Autumn 2011

Type : type of stressor

* A : Acaricides
* F : Fungicides
* H : Herbicides
* I : Insecticides
* IA : Insecticides + Acaricides
* S : Synergist 
* V : Virusses

Value : presence or absence (1/0) of the stressor (pesticides or virus)

This is a reference library of pollen types with information about their size and taxonomic position.
NB : the volume data have not been used.

* `Pollen_name` = pollen name as used in the different dataset including errors, typos etc...
* `Pollen_type` = clean pollen categories to be used (with some groupings)
* `Pollen_familly` = Botanical fammily of the pollen species
* `Pollen_code` : short code for `Pollen_type`
* `Polar_ref` and `equatorial_ref` = range of known sizes + letter providing the source of information (see below)
* `p` = polar size effectively used (for ranges we used the mean of the extreme values)
* `q` = equatorial size
* `vol` = volume of the ellipsoid calculated from r & q as 4/3 * r/2 *(q/2)^2
* `r` = mean radius used by louis to calculate the volume as a sphere
* `vol_r` = volume used by Louis based on r


Sources for the pollen sizes (from the scientific report of DEPAB1)
a – Source : Pollens de plantes mellifères d'Europe  
b- Source : "http://www-saps.plantsci.cam.ac.uk/pollen/"
c – Source : "http://journals.tubitak.gov.tr/botany/issues/bot-11-35-2/bot-35-2-5-0906-70.pdf"  
d – Source : "http://journals.tubitak.gov.tr/botany/issues/bot-99-23-3/bot-23-3-3-97003.pdf"  
e – Source : "http://nhm.openrepository.com/nhm/bitstream/10141/12605/1/Tweddle_Edwards_Fieller_Multivariate.pdf"  
f – Source : "http://www.geo.arizona.edu/palynology/pid00042.html"  
g – Source : "http://www.landesmuseum.at/pdf_frei_remote/PHY_20_3_4_0307-0323.pdf"  
h – Source : banque de données du CARI  
n - Noa pers.comm.e-mail 4/2/2015  = h
Note – Lorsque la dimension équatoriale n'est pas indiquée, le pollen peut être considéré comme sphérique

parts.name: coordinates
parts.description:
Geographic coordinates of the apiaries (IDApiary) in longitude-latitude, WGS84.   
The coordinates have been rounded here to two decimals to protect the beekeepers privacy. The original coordinates have been used to measure the surfaces of different crops and grasslands around the apiaries.

data.name: B-GOOD BIOEUNIS
data.long_name: Dataset from the B-GOOD project, containing the iogeographical EUNIS Level 2 Terrestrial Habitats (BIOEUNIS): Database of Relevant Resources for Honey Bees.
data.description: Dataset from B-GOOD BIOEUNIS Biogeographical [EUNIS](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7380) level 2 terrestrial habitats: The database of relevant resources for [honey bees](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/19) is an updated and refined version of the [EUNIS](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7380) terrestrial level 2 habitat product, which is divided into biogeographical regions. It is based on the deliverable D3.1 of the [B-GOOD project](https://b-good-project.eu/). The primary goal of BIOEUNIS was to develop a product that improves the spatial precision and accuracy of the [EUNIS](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7380) terrestrial level 2 habitat plant composition. It was published by Alves da Silva A, Alves J, Chytrý M, Sousa JP (UCOI) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/cdf42e4c-7e8c-44cc-a72c-dd080a16494f) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en).
data.data_overview: The data was published by Alves da Silva A, Alves J, Chytrý M,  Sousa JP (UCOI) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/cdf42e4c-7e8c-44cc-a72c-dd080a16494f) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en). It is an updated and refined version of the EUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat product, which is divided into biogeographical regions. It is based on Deliverable D3.1. (Database of Relevant Resources for Honey Bees).
data.data_value: The objectives of the B-GOOD project were: (1) Facilitate decision making for beekeepers and other stakeholders by establishing ready-to-use tools for operationalising the HSI; (2) Test, standardise and validate methods for measuring and reporting selected indicators affecting bee health; (3) Explore the various socio-economic and ecological factors beyond bee health; (4) Foster an EU community to collect and share knowledge related to honey bees and their environment; (5) Engender a lasting learning and innovation system (LIS); (6) Minimise the impact of biotic and abiotic stressors.
data.data_description: The dataset consists of 5 tables: *BIOEUNIS Status and Solution* (58.43 KB), *BF Index BIOEUNIS* (37.83 MB), *Species Average Cover BIOEUNIS* (37.81 MB), *Species BF Value* (413.78 KB) and *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS* (37.71 MB). In additionm it contains a metadata file (*BIOEUNIS - Database metadata.pdf*) and the BIOEUNIS-Biogeographical EUNIS Level 2 terrestrial habitats map (*BIOEUNIS.pdf*). The BIOEUNIS map depicts the spatial distribution of BIOEUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitats across Europe.
data.data_application: The dataset complies with all the criteria that datasets archived on the EU Pollinator Hub have to comply with. Additional metadata that describes the methods used to calculate the various parameters (Solution, Status, Bee-friendliness (BF) index, Average cover, Robustness, Occurrence) even better (*e.g.* links to documents, scientific articles) might be added and the publication Janovský Z. (2020) Pollinator spectrum. – www.pladias.cz mentioned in the metadata sheet should be reviewed, as it cannot be found on the link that was provided.
data.introduction: The BIOEUNIS Biogeographical EUNIS Level 2 Terrestrial Habitats Database of Relevant Resources for Honey Bees product is an updated and refined version of the EUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat product, which is divided into biogeographical regions. It is based on the deliverable D3.1: Database of Relevant Resources for Honey Bees. The primary goal of BIOEUNIS was to develop a product that improves the spatial precision and accuracy of the EUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat plant composition. As a result, we were able to better describe the habitats in terms of their importance as resources for honey bees. To that end, the EUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitats were divided into biogeographical regions. The BIOEUNIS is a new map of the biogeographical EUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitats, created as a result of this process. Using the new BIOEUNIS classes, all European vegetation plots in the EVA database were reclassified to these new BIOEUNIS habitat classes by implementing a modified version of the expert system: EUNIS-ESy (Expert system for automatic classification of European vegetation plots to EUNIS habitats, version: 2021-06-01). Using the BIOEUNIS classes, synoptic tables were created to determine the plant composition (occurrence and average cover) of each BIOEUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat. The BF Index was recalculated for each BIOEUNIS using the new plant composition of the BIOEUNIS classes and the BF Value of each plant species.
data.acquisition:
All raw data files were downloaded from the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) on 2024-09-23 11:47:02.

**List of raw data obtained from the data provider.**
1. File *BIOEUNIS - Database.xlsx*, accessed on 2024-09-23 11:47:02, provided by [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/cdf42e4c-7e8c-44cc-a72c-dd080a16494f)
2. File *BIOEUNIS - Map.pdf*, accessed on 2024-09-23 11:47:02, provided by [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/cdf42e4c-7e8c-44cc-a72c-dd080a16494f)

Metadata was obtained from the dataset's [web page](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/cdf42e4c-7e8c-44cc-a72c-dd080a16494f).
data.preparation:
All files in the zip-archives were extracted using File Explorer (Microsoft Corporation, version 22H2). 

File *BIOEUNIS - Database.xlsx* was procesed with MS Excel (Microsoft Corporation, version 2409). Data from all worksheets containing data (*Species BF Value*, *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS*, *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS*, *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS* and *Species BF Value*) were exported to a CSV format (UTF-8 encoding). Metadata in worksheet *Metadata* was exported in PDF formet. Data from files *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS.CSV*, *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS.CSV* and *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS.CSV* were unpivoted using the Python script *[UnpivotToCsv.py](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/pages/specific-data-preparation)*.

Data was then exported to the respective preparatory files and uploaded to the EU Pollinator Hub according to [SOP-017 (Dataset integration](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/pages/sop-directory).

parts.name: Species BF Value
parts.description: Table *Species BF Value table* contains the bee-friendliness plant species value (BF Value) that corresponds to the bee-friendliness of each plant species for honey bees and the robustness (Robustness) value associated with it (see Deliverable D3.1. section 3.2 on Methodology for further details). It is organized as a full list of 7998 plant species and their taxonomic groups, namely family and genus. The list of species present in this sheet is based on a dataset of 233,352 vegetation plots from the European Vegetation Archive (version 2020-05-16), classified by the EUNIS ESy expert system (version 2021-06-01) and resampled in geographical grid cells from Chytrý et al. (2020).
parts.structure:
* Column *Species* links to *BF Index BIOEUNIS.Species*
* Column *Species* links to *Species Average Cover BIOEUNIS.Species*
* Column *Species* links to *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS.Species*
parts.changes: None
parts.unresolved: None

columns.name: ﻿Species
columns.description: Name of the plant species following the [EURO MED nomenclature](https://europlusmed.org/) for which the BF-index in a given BIOEUNIS habitat refers to.

descriptor.name: scientificName
descriptor.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_scientificName):

> The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a [dwc:Identification](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7463), this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the [dwc:identificationQualifier](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7465) term.

columns.name: Genus
columns.description: Name of the genus the plant species belongs to, following the [EURO MED nomenclature](https://europlusmed.org/) for which the BF-index in a given BIOEUNIS habitat refers to.

descriptor.name: genus
descriptor.description: > The full scientific name of the genus in which the [dwc:Taxon](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7451) is classified.

columns.name: Family
columns.description: Name of the family the plant species belongs to, following the [EURO MED nomenclature](https://europlusmed.org/) for which the BF-index in a given BIOEUNIS habitat refers to.

descriptor.name: family
descriptor.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_family):
> The full scientific name of the family in which the [dwc:Taxon](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7451) is classified.

columns.name: BF Value
columns.description: Bee-friendliness (BF) index developed by the [B-GOOD project](https://b-good-project.eu), that corresponds to the contribution of each plant species in terms of bee-friendliness within a particular BIOEUNIS habitat. The BF index was calculated as the multiplication of the BF Value by occurrence and by average cover, i.e. BF Index = BF Value x Occurrence x Average cover. The higher the BF index, the greater the contribution of a plant species in terms of bee-friendliness within the habitat.

descriptor.name: beeFriendlinessIndex
descriptor.description: Bee-friendliness (BF) index developed by the [B-GOOD project](https://b-good-project.eu), that corresponds to the contribution of each plant species in terms of bee-friendliness within a particular BIOEUNIS habitat. The BF index was calculated as the multiplication of the BF Value by occurrence and by average cover, i.e. BF Index = BF Value x Occurrence x Average cover. The higher the BF index, the greater the contribution of a plant species in terms of bee-friendliness within the habitat.

columns.name: Robustness
columns.description: Robustness value (Robustness) associated with the bee-friendliness plant species value (BF Value) that corresponds to the bee-friendliness of each plant species for honey bees.

descriptor.name: Robustness
descriptor.description: Robustness value (Robustness) associated with the bee-friendliness plant species value (BF Value) that corresponds to the bee-friendliness of each plant species for honey bees.

parts.name: Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS
parts.description: Table *Species Occurrence BIOEUNIS* contains the percentage occurrence frequency (Occurrence) that was calculated as the number of occurrences relative to the total number of plots assigned to each BIOEUNIS Level 2 habitat. This sheet has 7998 plant species (like the Species BF Value sheet) present at each BIOEUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat. It is organized so the rows correspond to the plant species and the columns represent each BIOEUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat that is spatially explicitly defined at the EU scale in the Ecosystem Type Map (ETM) v3.1 (Weiss and Banko, 2018) and sub divided by Biogeographical regions (EEA, 2016) and that is defined in terms of vegetation composition.

parts.name: Species Average Cover BIOEUNIS
parts.description: Table *Species Average Cover BIOEUNIS* contains the average cover (Average cover) that was calculated as the percentage cover averaged across all the plots assigned to each BIOEUNIS Level 2 habitat, including the plots where a species was absent. This sheet has 7998 plant species (like the Species BF Value sheet) present at each BIOEUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat. It is organized so the rows correspond to the plant species and the columns represent each BIOEUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat that is spatially explicitly defined at the EU scale in the Ecosystem Type Map (ETM) v3.1 (Weiss and Banko, 2018) and sub divided by Biogeographical regions (EEA, 2016) and that is defined in terms of vegetation composition.

parts.name: BF Index BIOEUNIS
parts.description: Table *BF Index BIOEUNIS* contains the [bee-friendliness index](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7376) (BF Index) that corresponds to the contribution of each plant species in terms of bee-friendliness within a particular BIOEUNIS habitat (see Deliverable D3.1. section 2.4 of Methodology for further details). The BF index was calculated as the multiplication of the BF Value by occurrence and by average cover, i.e. BF Index = BF Value x Occurrence x Average cover. The higher the BF index, the greater the contribution of a plant species in terms of bee-friendliness within the habitat. This sheet has 7998 plant species (like the Species BF Value sheet) present at each EUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat. It is organized so the rows correspond to the plant species and the columns represent each BIOEUNIS terrestrial Level 2 habitat that is spatially explicitly defined at the EU scale in the Ecosystem Type Map (ETM) v3.1 (Weiss and Banko, 2018) and sub divided by Biogeographical regions (EEA, 2016) and that is defined in terms of vegetation composition.

descriptors.name: scientificName
descriptors.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_scientificName):

> The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a [dwc:Identification](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7463), this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the [dwc:identificationQualifier](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7465) term.
descriptors.notes: This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the [IdentificationQualifier](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7465) term. When applied to an [Organism](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7468) or [Occurrence](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7469), this term should be used to represent the scientific name that was applied to the associated [Organism](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7468) in accordance with the [Taxon](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7451) to which it was or is currently identified. Names should be compliant to the most recent nomenclatural code. For example, names of hybrids for algae, fungi and plants should follow the rules of the [International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants](https://www.iapt-taxon.org/nomen/main.php) (Shenzhen Code Articles[ H.1](https://www.iapt-taxon.org/nomen/pages/main/art_1.html), [H.2](https://www.iapt-taxon.org/nomen/pages/main/art_2.html) and [H.3](https://www.iapt-taxon.org/nomen/pages/main/art_3.html)). Thus, use the multiplication sign × (Unicode U+00D7, HTML ×) to identify a hybrid, not x or X, if possible.
descriptors.examples:
* Coleoptera (order)
* Vespertilionidae (family)
* Manis (genus)
* Ctenomys sociabilis (genus + specificEpithet)
* Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet)
* Roptrocerus typographi (Györfi, 1952) (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)
* Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)
* ×Agropogon littoralis (Sm.) C. E. Hubb.
* Mentha ×smithiana R. A. Graham
* Agrostis stolonifera L. × Polypogon monspeliensis (L.) Desf.

data.name: EUROSTAT HICP inflation rate
data.long_name: Harmonised index of consumer prices (HICP) inflation rate (tex00118)
data.description:
The dataset contains the average annual inflation rates based on the [Harmonised Index of Consumer Prices (HICP)](http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/Glossary:Harmonised_index_of_consumer_prices_(HICP)) in the European Union.
The [HICP](http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/Glossary:Harmonised_index_of_consumer_prices_(HICP)) gives comparable measures of [inflation](http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/Glossary:Inflation) for the countries and country groups for which it is produced. It is an economic indicator that measures the change over time of the prices of consumer goods and services acquired by households. In other words, it is a set of consumer price indices (CPIs) calculated according to a harmonised approach and a set of definitions as laid down in Regulations and Recommendations.
In addition, the HICP provides the official measure of consumer price inflation in the [euro area](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php?title=Glossary:Euro_area) for the purposes of monetary policy and the assessment of inflation convergence as required under the Maastricht criteria for accession to the euro.
data.acquisition:
All raw data files were downloaded from the website of [EUROSTAT](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/) on 2025-01-17.

**List of raw data obtained from the data provider.**

File *estat_tec00118_filtered_en_aggregates.csv.gz*, accessed on 2025-01-17 12:06:57, provided by [EUROSTAT](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/view/tec00118__custom_15063231/default/table?lang=en) with the following settings: Online data code
prc_hicp_aind|Geopolitical entity all Aggregates|Time 1996-2024|Classification of individual consumption purpose (COICOP) [CP00] All-items HICP|Unit of measure: [RCH_A_AVG]
Annual average rate of change
File *estat_tec00118_filtered_en_countries.csv.gz*, accessed on 2025-01-16 12:06:33, provided by [EUROSTAT] with the following settings: Online data code
prc_hicp_aind|Geopolitical entity all Countries and territories|Time 1996-2024|Classification of individual consumption purpose (COICOP) [CP00] All-items HICP|Unit of measure: [RCH_A_AVG]
Annual average rate of change(https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/view/tec00118__custom_15063231/default/table?lang=en)
data.preparation: All files in the zip-archives were extracted using 7-Zip (Igor Pavlov, version 19.00). Data was processed with Notepad++ (v8.7.1) before integration on the EUPH. Dates were parsed to the required YYYY-MM-DD format using the python script [ParseDates.py](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/pages/specific-data-preparation).
data.analysis: The reults of data analysis were published in the EUPH article [European Honey Market](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/articles/2).

parts.preparation:
1. Missing values were replaced by {NULL} (367 occurrences).
2. NUTS0 code for Greece {EL} was replaced by the ISO-3166 alpha-2 code {GR} (12 records)
3. NUTS0 code for United Kingdom {UK} was replaced by the ISO-3166 alpha-2 code {GB} (12 records)
4. Codes and labels, which are separated by a {:} were separated by the column delimiter {;} for the columns freq, unit, coicop and geo, headers were added/changed to (freq_code/freqlabel), (unit_code/unit_label), (coicop_code/coicop_label) and (geo_code/geo_label), respectively.

descriptors.name: alpha-2CountryCode
descriptors.description: > A two-letter code that represents a country name, recommended as the general purpose code.

descriptors.name: country
descriptors.description: > A collective generic term that refers here to a wide variety of dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, uninhabited islands, and other entities in addition to the traditional countries or independent states.
descriptors.notes: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the [Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names](https://www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabularies/tgn/). Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the [dcterms:Location](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7367) spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the [dcterms:Location](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7367) might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term [dwc:higherGeography](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7477) or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

descriptors.name: year
descriptors.description:
A term from the [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwc_year):
> The four-digit year in which the [dwc:Event](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7474) occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

descriptors.name: dateModified
descriptors.description: [Calendar date and local time of day](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7329) of the last update of [a record](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7515) or [a data element](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7519) or [a content](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/872).
descriptors.notes: According to the [DCMI Metadata Terms Vocabulary](https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dcmi-terms/#modified) recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property [Date](https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dcmi-terms/#http://purl.org/dc/terms/date), of which this is a subproperty. According to [Darwin Core standard](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dcterms_modified) recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to [ISO 8601-1:2019](https://www.iso.org/standard/70907.html).
descriptors.examples:
* 1963-03-08T14:07-0600 (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC)
* 2009-02-20T08:40Z (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC)
* 2018-08-29T15:19 (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018)
* 1809-02-12 (some time during 12 February 1809)
* 1906-06 (some time in June 1906)
* 1971 (some time in the year 1971)
* 2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC)
* 1900/1909 (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909)
* 2007-11-13/15 (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007)

data.name: FAOSTAT QCL Pollinated Crops
data.long_name: FAOSTAT data on production of pollinated crops
data.description: This dataset contains data related to crops that require pollination by animals according to Klein *et al.* 2007 from the FAOSTAT crop and livestock statistics. It includes also the relevant metadata published by FAO.
data.acquisition: File *Production_Crops_Livestock_E_All_Data_(Normalized).zip* was downloaded from the [website of the Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database FAOSTAT](https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/QCL) provided by [FAO](https://www.fao.org) on 2025-04-01 14:37:21.
data.preparation: Raw data files were processed using a SQL database (MariaDB foundation, server version 10.4.32) running in an XAMPP environment (BitRock, version 5.2.1).

descriptors.notes: Terms in the dwciri namespace are intended to be used in RDF with [non-literal objects](https://dwc.tdwg.org/rdf/#252-using-terms-in-the-darwin-core-dwciri-namespace-with-non-literal-objects-identified-by-iri-references-non-normative).

descriptors.name: measurementValue
descriptors.description: > The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.
descriptors.notes: This term has an equivalent in the [dwciri: namespace](https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/#dwciri_measurementValue) that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

descriptors.name: maximumMeasurementValue
descriptors.description: The upper limit of a range of [measurement Values](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/7522).
descriptors.notes: To be used if a measurement can only be expressed as a range of values. To be used in combination with [minimumMeasurementValue](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dashboard/descriptors/854).

data.name: FAOSTAT PP Producer Prices
data.long_name: FAOSTAT data on producer prices
data.description: This dataset contains data related to producer prices of pollinated crops that require pollination by animals according to Klein *et al.* 2007 and beekeeping products such as honey and beewax  from the FAOSTAT crop and livestock statistics. It includes also the relevant metadata published by FAO.
data.acquisition: File *Prices_E_All_Data_(Normalized).zip* was downloaded from the [website of the Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database FAOSTAT](https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/PP) provided by [FAO](https://www.fao.org) on 2025-04-01 15:09:07.
data.preparation: Raw data files were processed using a SQL database (MariaDB foundation, server version 10.4.32) running in an XAMPP environment (BitRock, version 5.2.1).

data.name: B-GOOD Bee Counter Data
data.long_name: Dataset from the B-GOOD project, containing data from bee counters on daily exits and entrances of bees from colonies.
data.description: The dataset contains records of daily number of exits and entrances of bees from 6 colonies per location in 2023 in the locations Avignon/France (2023-03-31 – 2023-05-15), Halle/Germany (2023-05-17 – 2023-11-15) and Gent/Belgium (2023-06-02 – 2023-11-15). It was published by Alaux CA (INRAE) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en).
data.data_overview: The data was published by Alaux CA (INRAE) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en). It contains records of daily number of exits and entrances of bees from 6 colonies per location in 2023 in the locations Avignon/France (31.03.2023 – 15.11.2023), Halle/Germany (2023-05-17 – 2023-11-15) and Gent/Belgium (2023-06-02 – 2023-11-15).
data.data_value: The objectives of the B-GOOD project were: (1) Facilitate decision making for beekeepers and other stakeholders by establishing ready-to-use tools for operationalising the HSI; (2) Test, standardise and validate methods for measuring and reporting selected indicators affecting bee health; (3) Explore the various socio-economic and ecological factors beyond bee health; (4) Foster an EU community to collect and share knowledge related to honey bees and their environment; (5) Engender a lasting learning and innovation system (LIS); (6) Minimise the impact of biotic and abiotic stressors.
data.data_description: The dataset consists of one table (591,97 KB), which contains 6.960 records.
data.data_application: Currently, the data integrated from the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/) contains maior issues and does not comply with the [FAIR Guiding Principles for scientific data management and stewardship](https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/) applied on the EU Pollinator Hub. More descriptive information about the context, quality and condition, or characteristics of the data (*e.g.* protocols, measurement devices used, units of the captured data, or any other details about the study) must be provided. More metadata in the form of accurate and relevant attributes (*e.g. *metadata that describes the scope of the data has been described, any particularities or limitations about the data that other users should be aware of, specification of the date of generation/collection of the data, the lab conditions, who prepared the data, the parameter settings, the name and version of the software used, specification of whether it is raw or processed data, explanation of all variable names are explained if they are not self-explanatory) must be provided. It requires major revisions by the data provider.
data.introduction:
The data was published by Alaux CA (INRAE) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en). The dataset contains records of daily number of exits and entrances of bees from 6 colonies per location in 2023 in the locations Avignon/France (31.03.2023 – 15.11.2023), Halle/Germany (17.05.2023 – 15.11.23) and Gent/Belgium (02.06.2023 – 15.11.23).

The objectives of the B-GOOD project were: (1) Facilitate decision making for beekeepers and other stakeholders by establishing ready-to-use tools for operationalising the HSI; (2) Test, standardise and validate methods for measuring and reporting selected indicators affecting bee health; (3) Explore the various socio-economic and ecological factors beyond bee health; (4) Foster an EU community to collect and share knowledge related to honey bees and their environment; (5) Engender a lasting learning and innovation system (LIS); (6) Minimise the impact of biotic and abiotic stressors.
data.acquisition:
All raw data files were downloaded from the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) on 2024-09-23 18:47:55.

**List of raw data obtained from the data provider.**
1. File *bee-counters-exen-daily-counts*, accessed on 2024-09-23 18:47:55, provided by [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/48186e29-93de-44c2-8d49-8d29c72857f8)

Metadata was obtained from the web pages of the dataset's [web page](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/48186e29-93de-44c2-8d49-8d29c72857f8).
data.preparation:
The file in the zip-archive was extracted using File Explorer (Microsoft Corporation, version 22H2).

The file *GOOD_Virus_Data_2018_2020 Pool size.xlsx* was processed with MS Excel (Microsoft Corporation, version 2409). Column *date* was separated into column *time* and *date* and correctly formated to ISO 8601 format and the additional columns *city*, *NUTS3*, *device*, *device_ID* and *direction* were inserted and filled with the appropriate information. The worksheets were then exported to separate data files in CSV format (UTF-8 encoding) and imported into Notepad++ (version 8.7) where missing values were substituted by {NULL} using regular expressions. All data files were then merged using the Python script *[MergeCsv.py](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/pages/specific-data-preparation)*. Finally, the merged data file was unpivoted using the Python script *[UnpivotToCsv.py](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/pages/specific-data-preparation)*.

Data was then exported to the respective preparatory files and uploaded to the EU Pollinator Hub according to [SOP-017 (Dataset integration](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/pages/sop-directory).

parts.name: bee counter data
parts.description: Daily number of exists and entrance of bees at colony level. The structure of the table provided by the B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal has been modified and the data has been enriched in order to facilitate data standardisation as well as automated validation and analysis of the data.
parts.preparation:
1. Columns *city* and *NUTS3* were inserted. Values in the columns were derived from the metadata provided by the data owner on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/48186e29-93de-44c2-8d49-8d29c72857f8).
2. Colum *time* was inserted. Values in columns *date* and *time* were derived from the datetime in column *date* in the raw data provided on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/48186e29-93de-44c2-8d49-8d29c72857f8). The meaning of the datetime was not specified by the data provider but there are good reasons to assume that this is the date and time of data transmission by the remote sensors, which did not occur at the same time in all records (either 01:00 or 02:00 am) . In order to facilitate automated data processing it has been decided to store date and time separately, as the exact time of transmission might be irrelevant.
3. Column *device* was inserted. Values in column *device* were derived from the header of the values acquired with the respective device in the raw data provided on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/48186e29-93de-44c2-8d49-8d29c72857f8)].
4. Column *device_ID* was inserted. Values in column *device_ID* were derived from the assumed device name contained in column device.
5. Column *direction* was inserted. Values in column *direction* were derived from the direction of movements of bees at the hive entrance ({in}: bees entering the beehive; {out}: bees leaving the beehive) extracted from the column device.
parts.changes: 1. In 138 records in which column *number* contained missing data (114 records for location INRAE, 18 records for location HALLE, 6 records for location GENT) it was replaced by {NULL}.
parts.unresolved:
1. Due to the missing description of the data it is unclear what the time provided with the date in the [raw data](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/48186e29-93de-44c2-8d49-8d29c72857f8) refers to. The data provider is requested to make this information available.
2. It is unclear, whether the number of bees entering or leaving the beehive reported in the [raw data](https://beehealthdata.org/datasets/48186e29-93de-44c2-8d49-8d29c72857f8) refer to the date provided in column date or to the previous day, given that the time provided with the date (either 01:00 or 02:00) is often used as transmission time for remote devices. The data provider is requested to make this information available.
3. Extreme outliers have been found in the number of bees entering and exiting the hive, which should be further investigated by the data provider.

descriptor.description: [A NUTS code](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/vocabulary/classes/3328) defined in the [NUTS classification 2021](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg_del/2019/1755/oj), valid from 2021-01-01 to 2023-12-31, containing 92 regions at NUTS level 1, 244 regions at NUTS level 2 and 1165 regions at NUTS level 3 level.

columns.name: date
columns.description: [Calendar date](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7408) extracted from the colmun *date* in the raw data file of the data provider. Its exact meaning is not specified by the data provider. Presumably the [calendar date](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7408) on which the values provided in the column *number* were measured.

columns.name: time
columns.description: [Local time of day](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7417) extracted from the colmun *date* in the raw data of the data provider. Its exact meaning is not specified by the data provider. Presumably the [Local time of day](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7417) on which the values were transmitted by the remote sensing device.

data.name: B-GOOD Health Monitoring
data.long_name: Dataset from the B-GOOD project, containing data from studies on diseases detected in honey bee colonies.
data.description: The dataset contains results from the analysis of the [pathogens](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/97) [Deformed Wing  Virus A](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7418) (DWV-A), [Deformed Wing Virus B](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/7419) (DWV-B); [Acute Bee Paralysis Virus](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/99) (ABPV), [Chronic Bee Paralysis Virus](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/100) (CBPV), [Black Queen Cell Virus](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/103) (BQCV), [Sackbrood Virus](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/105) (SBV), [Paenibacillus larvae](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/89);  [Melissococcus plutonius](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/90); [Nosema apis](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/92); [Nosema ceranae](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/93); [Malpighamoeba mellificae](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/96); [Varroa destructor](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/80) in [honey bee](https://app.pollinatorhub.eu/dictionary/classes/19) samples collected in spring, summer and autumn of 2020, 2021 and 2022 in different locations. It was published by Schäfer MO (FLI) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en).
data.data_overview: The data was published by Schäfer MO (FLI) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en). It contains results from the analysis of pathogens (Deformed Wing Virus A, DWV A; Deformed Wing Virus B, DWV B; Acute Bee Paralysis Virus, ABPV; Chronic Bee Paralysis Virus CBPV; Black Queen Cell Virus BQCV; Sackbrood Virus, SBV; *Paenibacillus larvae*; *Melissococcus plutonius*; *Nosema apis*; *Nosema ceranae*; *Malpighamoeba mellificae*; *Varroa destructor*) in bee samples collected in spring, summer and autumn of 2020, 2021 and 2022 in different locations.
data.data_value: The objectives of the B-GOOD project were: (1) Facilitate decision making for beekeepers and other stakeholders by establishing ready-to-use tools for operationalising the HSI; (2) Test, standardise and validate methods for measuring and reporting selected indicators affecting bee health; (3) Explore the various socio-economic and ecological factors beyond bee health; (4) Foster an EU community to collect and share knowledge related to honey bees and their environment; (5) Engender a lasting learning and innovation system (LIS); (6) Minimise the impact of biotic and abiotic stressors.
data.data_description: The datset contains two tables. One contains the results from the pilot studies (1029 records, 333,43 kB), one the results from the field studies (769 records, 233,42 kB).
data.data_application: Currently, the data integrated from the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org/) contains major issues and does not comply with the [FAIR Guiding Principles for scientific data management and stewardship](https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/) applied on the EU Pollinator Hub. More descriptive information about the context, quality and condition, or characteristics of the data (*e.g.* protocols, measurement devices used, units of the captured data, or any other details about the study) must be provided. More metadata in the form of accurate and relevant attributes (*e.g. *metadata that describes the scope of the data has been described, any particularities or limitations about the data that other users should be aware of, specification of the date of generation/collection of the data, the lab conditions, who prepared the data, the parameter settings, the name and version of the software used, specification of whether it is raw or processed data, explanation of all variable names are explained if they are not self-explanatory) must be provided. It requires major revisions by the data provider.
data.introduction:
The data was published by Schäfer MO (FLI) on the [B-GOOD Bee Health Data Portal](https://beehealthdata.org) as part of the [B-GOOD project (grant agreement 817622)](https://b-good-project.eu/), funded under the [EU Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-2020_en). The dataset contains results from the analysis of pathogens (Deformed Wing Virus A, DWV A; Deformed Wing Virus B, DWV B; Acute Bee Paralysis Virus, ABPV; Chronic Bee Paralysis Virus CBPV; Black Queen Cell Virus BQCV; Sackbrood Virus, SBV; *Paenibacillus larvae*; *Melissococcus plutonius*; *Nosema apis*; *Nosema ceranae*; *Malpighamoeba mellificae*; *Varroa destructor*) in bee samples collected in spring, summer and autumn of 2020, 2021 and 2022 in different locations.

The objectives of the B-GOOD project were: (1) Facilitate decision making for beekeepers and other stakeholders by establishing ready-to-use tools for operationalising the HSI; (2) Test, standardise and validate methods for measuring and reporting selected indicators affecting bee health; (3) Explore the various socio-economic and ecological factors beyond bee health; (4) Foster an EU community to collect and share knowledge related to honey bees and their environment; (5) Engender a lasting learning and innovation system (LIS); (6) Minimise the impact of biotic and abiotic stressors.
